content: This is why I DO want my kids to go to college. Choose your college and professors wisely and you are getting the best resource. Of course, it depends what you value. There may be better entrepreneurial knowledge outside of college, but as a whole, you would be hard pressed to assemble the expertise of a good university. There are no doubt many problems (such as cost) with college, but people who dismiss a college education tend to construct their arguments on generalizations that oversimplify, ignore nuance, and, in cases where they have benefitted from a college education, willfully ignore the benefits they have received from it. But the myth of the self-made man has enduring appeal and demagoguery has proved successful for certain people…to a point.
